nodes.bodyText: I tend to be in favour of the sessionFactory.getCurrentSession().createCriteria(Encounter.class).add(eq("uuid", uuid)).uniqueResult() pattern.
This should probably be addPersonReference, given its reliance on name. Also, shouldn't we just pass the UUID in here?
Probably then should just have addPatientReference(org.openmrs.Patient patient)
I don't think we should be populating the identifier field, as it's primarily intended for logical references, where as this is a proper resource reference.
Instead of doing the formatting here, we should just pass the result of PersonName#getFullName() into this method and use that as the display name.

The reference Id should be left unset, so that it's set at run-time. Conceptually, this UUID is specific to the Patient resource and the reference to the patient resource is an entirely different object.
I would move this to the FhirUtils class. We will need it in many places.

Just use the value from FhirConstants. The purpose of FhirTestConstants is for some constants needed across tests that aren't constants in the application, e.g., the LOINC_SYSTEM_URL or CIEL_SYSTEM_URN are actually determined at runtime from the database, but for testing purposes, we can use fixed values.
We should probably consider renaming either this file to FhirReferenceUtils or the file in the omod to FhirServerUtils (I favour the second of these) just to avoid confusion.

I think instead of the IDENTIFIER constant, we should use patient.getPatientIdentifier().getIdentifier().getIdentifierType().getName(); the reason is, not all implementations use only a single identifier per patient.
You're right. Didn't thought of that.
